comment.body:
I'm updating using "git pull"...
Having used a symlink instead of renaming the plugin's directory I'm curiously waiting for an update of this plugin...
;-)

> [eventi](#comment_3_1DcDDitsjFJohvwonPmpibRChmA7uGxqL7): That is interesting - Maybe they could switch to the way ubuntu does it...

Using git is not distribution specific.

What about multiuser and deleting sites?
I get "This function is disabled on this proxy" now...

```
    # Disable not Multiuser safe functions
    def actionSiteDelete(self, to, *args, **kwargs):
        self.cmd("notification", ["info", "This function is disabled on this proxy"])
```

So how do I clean up all that poop I accidentally caught in ZeroNet now?

```
1.Hitchhiker 25:
(41) Deep Thought paused for a moment's reflection.
(42) ''Tricky,'' he said finally.
```

Maybe at least the "master" of that "proxy" should be allowed to clean up...
